mdRecord.dcterms:title: De laudibus legum Angliæ / Written originally in Latin by Sir John Fortescue, Lord Chief Justice .. Tr. into English, illustrated with the notes of Mr. Selden, and great variety of remarks with respect to the antiquities, history, and laws of England. To which are prefix'd Mr. Selden to the reader, and a large historical preface. To the whole are added the preface of the first editor, with the testimonies of Bale, Pitts, and Du Fresne; the Summs of Sir Ralph de Hengham, Lord Chief Justice to King Edward I. .. with Mr. Selden's notes; and a copious index
Fortescue, John, Sir, 1394?-1476?. De laudibus legum Angliae. English
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Fortescue, John Sir, 1394?-1476?
Gregor, Francis
Hengham, Ralph de, -1311
Selden, John, 1584-1654
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: In the Savoy, Printed by H. Lintot for D. Browne
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "The preface of the first editor" is in Latin and has separate paging (1 l., ii, 36 p.) and special t.-p.: Fortescue De laudibus legum Angliæ. Præmittuntur præfatio primi editoris, &, testimonia Balei, Pitsei & Du Fresne ... Londini, typis E. & R. Nutt, & R. Gosling, 1737.

The Hengham magna and Hengham parva are in Latin and have separate paging (1 l., iii, [1], 42 p.) and special t.-p.: Radvlphi De Hengham Edwardi Regis I. Capitalis olim justitiarii summæ. Magna Hengham, & parva, vulgò nuncupatæ. ex vett. codd. mss. cum cl. Seldeni notis. Londini, typis E. & R. Nutt, & R. Gosling, 1737.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Law--Great Britain.
Constitutional law--Great Britain.
